PROJECTS TAKEN.Description:
Assisted Support Desktop is a desktop applications used by Microsoft Agents for supporting customers and servicing customer service requests. The application is used for hosting various tools and applications which enable Agents to serve customer requests. I was given the responsibility for improving the application experience and making it accessible to agents with disability like partial or complete visual impairment, hard of hearing, etc. I was responsible for easing the experience of multiple complex user scenarios and making the tool accessible compliant with various accessibility tools like JAWS, NVidia, Windows Narrator, Magnifier, etc. I was awarded the IT Excellence award in “Experiment, Learn & Move On quickly” category for driving the accessibility compliance.
Technologies: ASP.NET 4.0, WPF, C#, HTML, CSS, Knockout, ASP.NET MVC, jQuery

PROJECTS TAKEN.Title of Project: Phoenix - Microsoft Professional Services Catalog Management
PROJECTS TAKEN.Description: Phoenix is a Catalog Management System which manages and masters all Services and Offerings for Microsoft Professional Services. It’s a high performant web application which manages and master huge data. It has been developed on top on ASP.NET 4.5 framework and the basic architecture follows the principle of CQRS. Frontend is based on Angular.js. I have been involved in architecting and developing the solution from grounds-up. I have been involved in developing the basic framework and have delivered major business and engineering features. I have been involved in implementing notable engineering features like CI/CD, automated integration testing and telemetry. The system is hosted completely on Cloud (Microsoft Azure) and uses Cloud Offerings like Cloud Service, Azure SQL, Azure Table, Blob Storages, Azure Service Bus and Redis Cache. Shortly after releasing the system to Production, it was awarded the Customer Obsessed IT Excellence Award in April 2016. I was awarded a separate Excellence Award under Growth Mindset category for my contribution to the project. Currently I am working on re-architecting and integrating the system with other downstream and upstream systems.

Phoenix Catalogue - Modern E-Commerce based Catalogue Search
PROJECTS TAKEN.Description:
It’s a modern Web based Catalogue Search, which is used for Searching Microsoft Service offerings around the Globe. The application is used widely by Microsoft Technical Account Managers (TAM), TAMs refer to the application for checking the availability, pricing and details of Microsoft Services around the world before offering them to Customers. The site has a user base of more than 12K users and caters to about 80K search requests. The application has features like modern E-Commerce sites like smart search, auto-suggestions, extensive filtering and faceted navigations and personalization.
My responsibilities in the project included: integrating lucene based Azure Search Engine with the application and developing the Frontend of the site, based on Angular.js. 
The project has received appreciations for its responsiveness and sleak UI.
